main event: A cylindrical-cone-like object with a bluish-white lead part and reddish tail was observed in the sky over Springfield, Massachusetts on February 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3-5 minutes, moving in an erratic manner.
The observer, a machinist, was attracted to the light of the object.
The object was observed to be directly overhead, moving straight and then instantly to the east.
The observation occurred on a clear, dark night with moderate air traffic, including some B-52s.
A nearby B-52 aircraft was observed starting its landing approach around the same time, with its terrain lights turned on.
sighted object: cylindrical-cone-like object with bluish-white lead part and reddish tail
